events.name: Play Therapy and Basic Techniques Training
events.description:
Training Content

What to do when optimal conditions for play therapy cannot be met?
What is Theraplay? What are its areas of use?
How should play therapy interventions be conducted in processes that need to be carried out online?
The use of the therapeutic power of play in disaster and social trauma processes.
The training will be conducted over 5 days (32 hours) in total. Training materials are included.

Training Objectives

To gain competence in the therapeutic use of play,
To inform about ensuring optimal conditions for material and environment preparation,
To determine the roadmaps to follow in selecting techniques specific to the client,
To specify the convergent and divergent points in play therapy through schools,
To develop practical skills with the help of basic knowledge and theoretical approaches.
Participation Requirements:
Psychologists, Psychological Counselors, 3rd and 4th-year students of the departments, and graduate and postgraduate students can participate in our training.

events.name: Eating Disorders
events.description:
Training Content:

-Recognizing Eating Disorders
-DSM – 5 Diagnostic Criteria
-Anorexia Nervosa
-Bulimia Nervosa
-Binge Eating Disorder
-Atypical Anorexia Nervosa
-Night Eating Syndrome
-Emotional Hunger
-The Relationship Between Trauma and Eating Disorders
-The Effect of Self-Esteem, Confidence, and Body Image
-Taking History in the First Interview and Sample Case
-Approach to Eating Disorders Through Cognitive Behavioral Therapy
-Cognitive Structuring and Problem Solving Training
-Clinical Assessment and Treatment Methods
-Evaluation

events.name: Working in Preschool Institutions
events.description:
Working in the field of preschool education is an area chosen with excitement for some of us, a 'start somewhere' door for others, and an indispensable world for those who 'just stopped by'.

At a time when scientists and the literature shout 'Early childhood period is very important', it is wise to benefit from colleagues who have dedicated years to this field and can answer questions with their experience.

Our team member Uzm.Psk.Gözde Alper, even while focusing on clinical studies, has always had one foot in schools until recently. She will share her knowledge and experience with us again after a long time with practical, concrete examples, and applications. For those who will work in this field, the process will become clearer, and it will surely become easier for those already working.

The aim of the training is to provide in-depth knowledge and skills in this field, from communicating with children to duties in the institution, for those working or planning to work in the psychological support unit of preschool institutions. The content of the training includes many topics, from tracking the development of children to meeting with families, collaborating with teachers, and planning content.

We will digest some application-oriented topics with our active participation, and in the second session, we will discuss how to accompany the school, family, and child dimensions through frequent case studies.

events.name: Neuropsychological Tests Training
events.description:
NEUROPSYCHOLOGICAL TESTS (NPT) TRAINING WITH PROF. DR. SİREL KARAKAŞ AND HER TEAM IS STARTING FOR THE 6TH TIME!

🖥️ Our training will be held online.

✔️ Participants will receive a Moodist Academy Approved Training Certificate.

❓Who Can Participate in the Training?
-Graduates and students of Psychology, Psychological Counseling and Guidance, Child Development and Education, and similar departments, and those studying in the 3rd-4th year of the specified departments can participate.

🎯Training Objective

To provide general information about neuropsychology, neuropsychological assessment, and neuropsychological tests; to convey the validity of these tests, i.e., what they measure, and to gain the ability to apply, score, and interpret these tests.

🖇️ Tests are not included in the training fee.

events.name: SPSS Data Analysis
events.description:
Introducing SPSS, creating a data file and data entry, descriptive analyses, reliability, normality, correlation, t-test, ANOVA analysis, regression, and non-parametric analyses with examples

At the end of this training, you will be able to do your own thesis.

Participants must install the SPSS program on their computers before the training.

events.name: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy Program for Avoidant/Restrictive Food Intake Disorder
events.description:
Avoidant/Restrictive Food Intake Disorder (ARFID) is a heterogeneous psychiatric disorder characterized by individuals avoiding certain foods or food categories due to increased sensitivity to sensory characteristics (e.g., taste, texture, appearance, smell) of food and/or restricting intake in quantity. One of the most common reasons for avoidance and restriction in ARFID is increased sensitivity to sensory characteristics of food. Individuals diagnosed with ARFID may also avoid or restrict food due to fear of unwanted outcomes such as choking, vomiting, or gastrointestinal pain. These individuals often experience a trauma related to food and then begin to avoid certain foods to protect themselves from another adverse experience. Individuals with ARFID also often show a lack of interest in food or eating and may maintain a limited diet in terms of quantity. Those with lack of interest describe eating as a chore, and this is often reflected in a low appetite.

Psychological therapies are prominent in the treatment of ARFID. A cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT-AR) has been developed for ARFID. This therapy includes three optional modules that the therapist can apply depending on the patient’s primary maintenance mechanism. This therapy can be applied in an individual format or with family support, depending on the patient's age, and can last 20-30 sessions depending on the severity of the eating disorder. This training will address ARFID treatment from a psychotherapeutic perspective.

This program consists of 4 sessions and a total of 8 hours.

events.name: Free Webinar: Safe Haven: Psychotherapy with Children and Adolescents
events.description:
Participation is open to everyone and a digital participation certificate will be shared with live viewers.

We are coming together on the evening of September 12, 2024, at 21.00 to talk about the 'safe haven'.

The safe haven is a concept developed by Dr. Darcia Narvaez that describes the necessary care system for babies, children, and adolescents to reach their potential. The safe haven aims to meet the emotional, social, and physiological needs of children with evolutionary proven care practices and environmental conditions.

How to create a safe haven? How can psychotherapy and psychoeducation be used to provide a safe haven for babies, children, and adolescents? How can psychotherapists, parents, and educators collaborate to support the healthy development of children?

Let’s come together to grow and create a safe and supportive haven for our babies, children, and adolescents. Looking forward to seeing you on September 12 at 21:00.

events.name: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy Certification Program
events.description: The CBT Certification Program organized by Assoc. Dr. Itır Tarı Cömert consists of 10 modules and 130 hours. The content of the program is shaped parallel to the Beck Institute training program, developed in light of Assoc. Dr. Itır Tarı Cömert’s 20 years of CBT experiences. Participants will gain practical experience in using these techniques effectively and formulating them with the theoretical knowledge of CBT's basic concepts and techniques. The program is supported by various learning methods, such as applied sessions, example session videos, role plays, supervision-supported repeat sessions, and case analyses. This certification program aims to provide participants with comprehensive knowledge and skills in CBT. Assoc. Dr. Itır Tarı Cömert’s knowledge and experiences form an important resource to enhance the program's quality and offer participants an effective learning experience.

events.name: Free Webinar: Our New Assistant AI
events.description:
Participation is open to everyone and a digital participation certificate will be shared with live viewers.

We are coming together on the evening of October 3, 2024, at 21.00 to talk about the new era of our profession.

Can artificial intelligence do therapy, can it replace the therapist? How can psychologists benefit from artificial intelligence in psychotherapy, community mental health, schools, etc.?

Let’s grow and learn together. Looking forward to seeing you on October 3 at 21:00.

events.name: Free Webinar: Body in Couple Therapy
events.description:
Participation is open to everyone and a digital participation certificate will be shared with live viewers.

We are coming together on the evening of October 10, 2024, at 21.00 to talk about body-oriented work in couple therapy with Jennifer Gardner, an instructor from the International Sensorimotor Psychotherapy Institute.

How can we benefit from body-oriented work while working with couples? What are the body-oriented practices and techniques we can use to strengthen the couple's relationship?

Let’s grow and learn together. Looking forward to seeing you on October 10 at 21:00.
